Posts.EditableText:
This is probably a stupid question. but I have created a game in the Quest Desktop Version (5.8.0) and now wish to upload it to the online Editor to test it. because, as you can admire in my lengthy issues post Quest Desktop lacks accessibility in certain spots which are essential for testing whether things work as intended.
I casted the GUI aside to work at the .aslx-files themselves and wanted to check whether everything still compiles correctly. But when I click on "upload game" I can only publish it. Which, in all respect to my own Genius ( ;-) ) would probably be a bad idea as the game is at the Moment simply a bunch of Syntax testing and getting used to working with the code itself. Any suggestions?
Posts.HTML:
This is probably a stupid question. but I have created a game in the Quest Desktop Version (5.8.0) and now wish to upload it to the online Editor to test it.

because, as you can admire
in my lengthy issues post
Quest Desktop lacks accessibility in certain spots which are essential for testing whether things work as intended.

I casted the GUI aside to work at the .aslx-files themselves and wanted to check whether everything still compiles correctly. But when I click on "upload game" I can only publish it. Which, in all respect to my own Genius ( ;-) ) would probably be a bad idea as the game is at the Moment simply a bunch of Syntax testing and getting used to working with the code itself.

Any suggestions?

Posts.EditableText: The survey helps the my cfa survey company to overcome the problems which are faced by the customers and serves even much better than the previous. And the survey will be very simple to access and it will take only a few minutes of your time.
